A Prayer<S>8605</S> of Moses<S>4872</S> the man<S>376</S> of God<S>430</S>. Lord<S>136</S>, thou hast been our dwelling place<S>4583</S> in all<S>1755</S> generations<S>1755</S>. <sup>A Prayer: or, A Prayer, being a Psalm of Moses</sup> <sup>in: Heb. in generation and generation</sup>
Before the mountains<S>2022</S> were brought forth<S>3205</S>, or ever thou hadst formed<S>2342</S> the earth<S>776</S> and the world<S>8398</S>, even from everlasting<S>5769</S> to<S>5704</S> everlasting<S>5769</S>, thou art God<S>410</S>.
Thou turnest<S>7725</S> man<S>582</S> to destruction<S>1793</S>; and sayest<S>559</S>, Return<S>7725</S>, ye children<S>1121</S> of men<S>120</S>.
For a thousand<S>505</S> years<S>8141</S> in thy sight<S>5869</S> are but as<S>3117</S> yesterday<S>865</S> when it is past<S>5674</S>, and as a watch<S>821</S> in the night<S>3915</S>. <sup>when: or, when he hath passed them</sup>
Thou carriest them away as with a flood<S>2229</S>; they are as a sleep<S>8142</S>: in the morning<S>1242</S> they are like grass<S>2682</S> which groweth up<S>2498</S>. <sup>groweth: or, is changed</sup>
In the morning<S>1242</S> it flourisheth<S>6692</S>, and groweth up<S>2498</S>; in the evening<S>6153</S> it is cut down<S>4135</S>, and withereth<S>3001</S>.
For we are consumed<S>3615</S> by thine anger<S>639</S>, and by thy wrath<S>2534</S> are we troubled<S>926</S>.
Thou hast set<S>7896</S> our iniquities<S>5771</S> before thee, our secret<S>5956</S> sins in the light<S>3974</S> of thy countenance<S>6440</S>.
For all our days<S>3117</S> are passed away<S>6437</S> in thy wrath<S>5678</S>: we spend<S>3615</S> our years<S>8141</S> as a tale<S>1899</S> that is told. <sup>passed: Heb. turned away</sup> <sup>as a: or, as a meditation</sup>
The days<S>3117</S> of our years<S>8141</S> are threescore<S>7657</S> years<S>8141</S> and ten<S>7657</S>; and if by reason of strength<S>1369</S> they be fourscore<S>8084</S> years<S>8141</S>, yet is their strength<S>7296</S> labour<S>5999</S> and sorrow<S>205</S>; for it is soon<S>2440</S> cut off<S>1468</S>, and we fly away<S>5774</S>. <sup>The days: Heb. As for the days of our years, in them are seventy years</sup>
Who knoweth<S>3045</S> the power<S>5797</S> of thine anger<S>639</S>? even according to thy fear<S>3374</S>, so is thy wrath<S>5678</S>.
So teach<S>3045</S> us to number<S>4487</S> our days<S>3117</S>, that we may apply<S>935</S> our hearts<S>3824</S> unto wisdom<S>2451</S>. <sup>apply: Heb. cause to come</sup>
Return<S>7725</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>, how long? and let it repent<S>5162</S> thee concerning thy servants<S>5650</S>.
O satisfy<S>7646</S> us early<S>1242</S> with thy mercy<S>2617</S>; that we may rejoice<S>7442</S> and be glad<S>8055</S> all our days<S>3117</S>.
Make us glad<S>8055</S> according to the days<S>3117</S> wherein thou hast afflicted<S>6031</S> us, and the years<S>8141</S> wherein we have seen<S>7200</S> evil<S>7451</S>.
Let thy work<S>6467</S> appear<S>7200</S> unto thy servants<S>5650</S>, and thy glory<S>1926</S> unto their children<S>1121</S>.
And let the beauty<S>5278</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> our God<S>430</S> be upon us: and establish<S>3559</S> thou the work<S>4639</S> of our hands<S>3027</S> upon us; yea, the work<S>4639</S> of our hands<S>3027</S> establish<S>3559</S> thou it.
